Introduction Section 1: Voting Method Frequencies National By State L2 Sample - National L2 Sample - By State Dynata Sample - National Dynata Sample - By State

Introduction Dr. Robert Stein1, Dr. Lonna Atkeson2, Dr. Trey Hood3, Mason Reece4 Section 1: Voting Method Frequencies National Mode of Voting Frequencies national_totals <- df %>% group_by(votingMethod) %>% tally() %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) reactable(national_totals, columns = list( votingMethod = colDef(name = "Mode of Voting", footer = "Total"), n = colDef(footer = function(values) sum(values)) ), defaultColDef = colDef(footerStyle = list(fontWeight = "bold"))) Presidential Candidate Frequencies national_presCandidate_totals <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% group_by(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% tally() %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) reactable(national_presCandidate_totals, columns = list( Q6.5_presCandidate = colDef(name = "Presidential Candidate", footer = "Total"), n = colDef(footer = function(values) sum(values)) ), defaultColDef = colDef(footerStyle = list(fontWeight = "bold"))) By State Mode of Voting Frequencies state_totals <- df %>% group_by(state) %>% tally() reactable( state_totals, details = function(index) { totals <- filter(df, state == state_totals$state[index]) %>% group_by(votingMethod) %>% tally() %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) %>% rename("Mode of Voting" = votingMethod) tbl <- reactable(totals, outlined = TRUE, highlight = TRUE, fullWidth = TRUE) }, columns = list( state = colDef(name = "State") ), onClick = "expand", rowStyle = list(cursor = "pointer"), pagination = F ) Presidential Candidate Frequencies state_presCandidate_totals <- df %>% reactable(totals, outlined = TRUE, highlight = TRUE, fullWidth = TRUE) }, columns = list( state = colDef(name = "State") ), onClick = "expand", rowStyle = list(cursor = "pointer"), pagination = F ) L2 section-2-absentee-vote-by-mail.html

Section 2: Absentee / Vote by Mail Q2.1: How many contests did you vote in on your 2020 ballot? Q2.2: Why did you request an absentee ballot? Please select all that apply. Q2.3: Have you voted absentee or by mail in a previous election? Q2.4: How did you request an absentee ballot? Q2.5: Did you log on to your voter registration record to do any of the following? Please select all that apply. Q2.6: How was your mail ballot delivered to you? Q2.7: Did you fill out your ballot with anyone else, such as a family member or friend, or did you complete your ballot by yourself? Q2.8: With whom did you complete your ballot? Please select all that apply. Q2.9: When did you return your mail ballot? Q2.10: Who returned your ballot or dropped it in the mail? Q2.11: How did you return your ballot? Q2.12: If someone else returned your ballot, how did they return your ballot? Q2.13: Did you return anyone else’s ballot? Q2.14: Whose ballot(s) did you return? Please select all that apply. Q2.16: Why did you decide to drop off your ballot rather than mail the ballot back in? Please select all that apply. Q2.17: Were you contacted by your local election official because there was a problem with your ballot and it could not be counted? Q2.18: Were you able to resolve the problem? Q2.20: Did you check to see if your ballot arrived at your County Elections office before Election Day? Q2.21: Overall, how difficult was it to follow all the instructions necessary to cast your ballot and return it to be counted? Q2.22: How concerned were you that your ballot would arrive at the County Clerk’s office in time to be counted? Q2.23: Did you encounter any problems marking or completing your ballot that may have interfered with your ability to cast your vote as intended? Q2.25: Given your experience this year with mail in voting, how likely are you to vote absentee next time?

Section 2: Absentee / Vote by Mail Q2.1: How many contests did you vote in on your 2020 ballot? Q2.1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.1) %>% group_by(Q2.1) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.1) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All of the contests", "Nearly all of the contests", "Most of the contests", "About half of the contests", "Just a few contests")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q2.1_data) Q2.2: Why did you request an absentee ballot? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q2.2_absent" = "I was going to be out of town for this election", "Q2.2_convenience" = "Voting by mail or absentee was just more convenient for me this election", "Q2.2_scheduling" = "I could not get to the poll on Election Day because of my work or school schedule", "Q2.2_military" = "I am in the armed forces / a domestic out of state voter", "Q2.2_disability" = "I have a physical disability that makes it difficult for me to go to the polls", "Q2.2_official_pollWorker" = "I was an election official or poll worker", "Q2.2_religion" = "Religious observances would have interfered with my going to the polls", "Q2.2_covid" = "I was worried about COVID-19", "Q2.2_onlyVBM" = "My state or locality only has vote-by-mail/absentee", "Q2.2_other" = "Other") Q2.2_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q2.2_absent:Q2.2_other, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q2.2_absent:Q2.2_other, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.2_data) Q2.3: Have you voted absentee or by mail in a previous election? Q2.3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.3_prevVBM) %>% group_by(Q2.3_prevVBM) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.3_prevVBM) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.3_data) Q2.4: How did you request an absentee ballot? Q2.4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.4_requestMethod) %>% group_by(Q2.4_requestMethod) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.4_requestMethod) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.4_data) Q2.5: Did you log on to your voter registration record to do any of the following? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q2.5_yes_absentee_sentTime" = "Yes, to check to see when my absentee ballot was sent to me", "Q2.5_yes_absentee_deliveryTime" = "Yes, to check to see if my absentee ballot arrived at the County Clerk's office", "Q2.5_yes_sampleBallot" = "Yes, to look at a sample ballot", "Q2.5_yes_checkRegistration" = "Yes, to check my voter registration", "Q2.5_other" = "Other", "Q2.5_no" = "No, did not check registration") Q2.5_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q2.5_yes_absentee_sentTime:Q2.5_no, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q2.5_yes_absentee_sentTime:Q2.5_no, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.5_data) Q2.6: How was your mail ballot delivered to you? Q2.6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.6_deliveryMethod) %>% group_by(Q2.6_deliveryMethod) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.6_deliveryMethod) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.6_data) Q2.7: Did you fill out your ballot with anyone else, such as a family member or friend, or did you complete your ballot by yourself? Q2.7_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.7_ballotBuddy) %>% group_by(Q2.7_ballotBuddy) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.7_ballotBuddy) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.7_data) Q2.8: With whom did you complete your ballot? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q2.8_ballotBuddy_partner" = "Spouse or partner", "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_roommate" = "Roomate", "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_friend" = "Friend", "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_party" = "Party or campaign worker", "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_nursing" = "Nursing home or medical aid", "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_other" = "Other") Q2.8_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q2.8_ballotBuddy_partner:Q2.8_ballotBuddy_unknown, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q2.8_ballotBuddy_partner:Q2.8_ballotBuddy_unknown, names_to = "response") %>% filter(response != "Q2.8_ballotBuddy_unknown") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.8_data) Q2.9: When did you return your mail ballot? Q2.9_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.9_returnDate) %>% group_by(Q2.9_returnDate) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.9_returnDate) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "After Election Day", "On Election Day", "2-3 days before Election Day", "One week before Election Day", "2-3 weeks before Election Day", "4 or more week before Election Day")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q2.9_data) Q2.10: Who returned your ballot or dropped it in the mail? Q2.10_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.10_returnPerson) %>% group_by(Q2.10_returnPerson) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.10_returnPerson) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.10_data) Q2.11: How did you return your ballot? Q2.11_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.11_returnMethod_voter) %>% group_by(Q2.11_returnMethod_voter) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.11_returnMethod_voter) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.11_data) Q2.12: If someone else returned your ballot, how did they return your ballot? Q2.12_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.12_returnMethod_someone) %>% group_by(Q2.12_returnMethod_someone) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.12_returnMethod_someone) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.12_data) Q2.13: Did you return anyone else’s ballot? Q2.13_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.13_returnOtherBallots) %>% group_by(Q2.13_returnOtherBallots) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.13_returnOtherBallots) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.13_data) Q2.14: Whose ballot(s) did you return? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_spouse" = "Spouse", "Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_parent" = "Parent/parents", "Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_child" = "Child/children", "Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_other_family" = "Other family member", "Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_friend" = "Friend", "Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_other" = "Other") Q2.14_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_spouse:Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_other, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_spouse:Q2.14_returnOtherBallots_other, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.14_data) Q2.16: Why did you decide to drop off your ballot rather than mail the ballot back in? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_convenience" = "It was very convenient to drop it off.", "Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_trust_usps" = "I didn't trust the USPS to deliver it on time.", "Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_time_usps" = "I didn't have enough time to use the USPS for return delivery.", "Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_certainty" = "I wanted to be certain that it arrived.", "Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_other" = "Other") Q2.16_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_convenience:Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_other, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_convenience:Q2.16_returnDropoffReason_other, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.16_data) Q2.17: Were you contacted by your local election official because there was a problem with your ballot and it could not be counted? Q2.17_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.17_contactedByElectionOfficial) %>% group_by(Q2.17_contactedByElectionOfficial) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.17_contactedByElectionOfficial) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.17_data) Q2.18: Were you able to resolve the problem? Q2.18_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.18_resolveProblem) %>% group_by(Q2.18_resolveProblem) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.18_resolveProblem) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.18_data) Q2.20: Did you check to see if your ballot arrived at your County Elections office before Election Day? Q2.20_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.20_checkArrival) %>% group_by(Q2.20_checkArrival) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.20_checkArrival) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.20_data) Q2.21: Overall, how difficult was it to follow all the instructions necessary to cast your ballot and return it to be counted? Q2.21_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.21_instructionQuality) %>% group_by(Q2.21_instructionQuality) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.21_instructionQuality) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very easy", "Somewhat easy", "Somewhat hard", "Very hard")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q2.21_data) Q2.22: How concerned were you that your ballot would arrive at the County Clerk’s office in time to be counted? Q2.22_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.22_returnConcern) %>% group_by(Q2.22_returnConcern) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.22_returnConcern) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very concerned", "Somewhat concerned", "Not too concerned", "Not at all concerned")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q2.22_data) Q2.23: Did you encounter any problems marking or completing your ballot that may have interfered with your ability to cast your vote as intended? Q2.23_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.23_interferingProblems) %>% group_by(Q2.23_interferingProblems) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.23_interferingProblems) freq_table_unsorted(Q2.23_data) Q2.25: Given your experience this year with mail in voting, how likely are you to vote absentee next time? Q2.25_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q2.25_voteVBMAgain) %>% group_by(Q2.25_voteVBMAgain) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q2.25_voteVBMAgain) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very likely", "Somewhat likely", "Not too likely", "Not at all likely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q2.25_data)
section-3-in-person-voting.html

Section 3: In-Person Voting Q3.1: How would you rate your voting experience overall? Q3.2: Approximately how long did you have to wait in line to vote? Q3.3: When you first checked in at the polling place to vote, which of the following statements most closely describes how you were asked to identify yourself? Q3.4: Please mark how much you agree or disagree with the following statements regarding the voting location where you voted: Q3.5: Please answer the following questions: Q3.6: How would you rate efforts at your polling location to prevent voters and poll workers from contracting the COVID-19 virus?

Section 3: In-Person Voting Q3.1: How would you rate your voting experience overall? Q3.1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.1_contestCount) %>% group_by(Q3.1_contestCount) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.1_contestCount) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All contests", "Nearly all contests", "Most contests", "About 1/2 of all contests", "Just a few contests")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.1_data) Q3.2: Approximately how long did you have to wait in line to vote? Q3.2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.2_waitTime) %>% group_by(Q3.2_waitTime) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.2_waitTime) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Not at all", "Less than 10 minutes", "10-30 minutes", "31 minutes to one hour", "More than one hour, please specify:")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.2_data) Q3.3: When you first checked in at the polling place to vote, which of the following statements most closely describes how you were asked to identify yourself? Q3.3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.3_identification) %>% group_by(Q3.3_identification) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.3_identification) freq_table_unsorted(Q3.3_data) Q3.4: Please mark how much you agree or disagree with the following statements regarding the voting location where you voted: The location was easy to find Q3.4_1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_easyFind) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_easyFind) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_easyFind) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_1_data) I had to go far out of my way to vote Q3.4_2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_farAway) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_farAway) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_farAway) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_2_data) It was hard to find a place to park Q3.4_3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_badParking) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_badParking) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_badParking) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_3_data) The poll workers were helpful Q3.4_4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_helpfulWorkers) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_helpfulWorkers) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_helpfulWorkers) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_4_data) My ballot privacy was protected Q3.4_5_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_privateBallot) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_privateBallot) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_privateBallot) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_5_data) The ballot was too long Q3.4_6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_longBallot) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_longBallot) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_longBallot) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_6_data) I felt safe from COVID-19 while voting in-person Q3.4_7_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.4_voteExperience_safeCOVID) %>% group_by(Q3.4_voteExperience_safeCOVID) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.4_voteExperience_safeCOVID) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Strongly agree", "Agree", "Disagree", "Strongly disagree")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.4_7_data) Q3.5: Please answer the following questions: Did someone in line at the polling place ask you who you were voting for? Q3.5_1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.5_votePrivacy_lineQuestion) %>% group_by(Q3.5_votePrivacy_lineQuestion) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.5_votePrivacy_lineQuestion) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Yes", "No")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.5_1_data) Did a poll worker look at your ballot and see who you were voting for? Q3.5_2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.5_votePrivacy_pollWorker) %>% group_by(Q3.5_votePrivacy_pollWorker) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.5_votePrivacy_pollWorker) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Yes", "No")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.5_2_data) Did another voter look at your ballot while you were voting or while you were in line to feed it into the vote tabulator? Q3.5_3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.5_votePrivacy_voterTabulator) %>% group_by(Q3.5_votePrivacy_voterTabulator) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.5_votePrivacy_voterTabulator) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Yes", "No")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.5_3_data) Did you keep your ballot in a privacy sleeve while you were moving around the vote center Q3.5_4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.5_votePrivacy_privacySleeve) %>% group_by(Q3.5_votePrivacy_privacySleeve) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.5_votePrivacy_privacySleeve) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Yes", "No")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.5_4_data) Q3.6: How would you rate efforts at your polling location to prevent voters and poll workers from contracting the COVID-19 virus? Q3.6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q3.6_covidSafety) %>% group_by(Q3.6_covidSafety) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q3.6_covidSafety) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, "Exellent" = "Excellent")) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Excellent", "Good", "Fair", "Poor")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q3.6_data)
section-4-voting-experience.html

Section 4: Voting Experience Q4.1: How would you rate your voting experience overall? Q4.2: How confident are you that YOUR vote in the General Election was counted as you intended? Q4.3 Thinking about your county, state, and the nation, how confident are you that all of the ballots were counted as the voters intended?

Section 4: Voting Experience Q4.1: How would you rate your voting experience overall? tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.1_experience) %>% group_by(Q4.1_experience) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.1_experience) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Excellent", "Good", "Fair", "Poor")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Q4.2: How confident are you that YOUR vote in the General Election was counted as you intended? tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.2_confidence) %>% group_by(Q4.2_confidence) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.2_confidence) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Q4.3 Thinking about your county, state, and the nation, how confident are you that all of the ballots were counted as the voters intended? Your county tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_county) %>% group_by(Q4.3_county) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_county) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Your state tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_state) %>% group_by(Q4.3_state) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_state) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Nationwide tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_nation) %>% group_by(Q4.3_nation) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_nation) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies)
section-5-election-security.html

Section 5: Election Security Q5.1: Please answer the following questions: Q5.2: Did anyone do any of the following? Please select all that apply. Q5.3: What was the result of this interaction? Q5.4: Who tried to make you vote the way you didn’t want to? Q5.5: According to the law, which candidate you vote for is supposed to be kept secret unless you tell someone. Even so, how easy or hard do you think it would be for politicians, union officials, or the people you work for to find out who you voted for, even if you told no one? Q5.6: Do you think elected officials can access voting records and figure out who a voter has voted for? Q5.7: Have you personally witnessed what you believe to be election or voter fraud in the 2020 Presidential Election? Q5.8: Which of the following situations did you personally observe in the 2020 Presidential Election? Please select all that apply. Q5.9: Below is a list of possible illegal election activities that may or may not take place in your state. How often you think each event occurs? Q5.10: Do you support or oppose requiring all people to show government issues photo ID when they vote? Q5.11: Do you think fraud changed the outcome of the Presidential election in your state?

Section 5: Election Security Q5.1: Please answer the following questions: How often does anyone, including friends or family, ask you which candidate you prefer or voted for? Q5.1_1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.1_familyQuestionsFrequency) %>% group_by(Q5.1_familyQuestionsFrequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.1_familyQuestionsFrequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or almost all of the time", "Most of the time", "Sometimes", "Rarely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.1_1_data) If a friend or family member asks you who you prefer in an election, how often do you name a candidate? Q5.1_2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.1_familyAnsweringFrequency) %>% group_by(Q5.1_familyAnsweringFrequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.1_familyAnsweringFrequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or almost all of the time", "Most of the time", "Sometimes", "Rarely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.1_2_data) If you tell a close friend or family member which candidate you prefer, how often do you tell the truth? Q5.1_3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.1_familyAnsweringTruthfully) %>% group_by(Q5.1_familyAnsweringTruthfully) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.1_familyAnsweringTruthfully) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or almost all of the time", "Most of the time", "Sometimes", "Rarely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.1_3_data) Ballots are changed by election workers. Q5.1_4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.1_workersChangeBallots) %>% group_by(Q5.1_workersChangeBallots) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.1_workersChangeBallots) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or almost all of the time", "Most of the time", "Sometimes", "Rarely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.1_4_data) Elected officials make rules that favor one party or another. Q5.1_5_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.1_officialsFavorableRules) %>% group_by(Q5.1_officialsFavorableRules) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.1_officialsFavorableRules) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or almost all of the time", "Most of the time", "Sometimes", "Rarely")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.1_5_data) Q5.2: Did anyone do any of the following? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q5.2_convince" = "Try and convince you to vote for someone that you didn't want to vote for", "Q5.2_command" = "Tell you to vote for someone that you didn't want to vote for", "Q5.2_threaten" = "Threaten you in someway to get you to vote for someone you didn't want to vote for", "Q5.2_mark" = "Mark your ballot for you, making choices that you would not have made", "Q5.2_none" = "No one did any of these") Q5.2_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q5.2_convince:Q5.2_command, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q5.2_convince:Q5.2_command, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.2_data) Q5.3: What was the result of this interaction? Q5.3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.3_interactionResult) %>% group_by(Q5.3_interactionResult) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.3_interactionResult) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.3_data) Q5.4: Who tried to make you vote the way you didn’t want to? Q5.4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.4_interactionInstigator) %>% group_by(Q5.4_interactionInstigator) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.4_interactionInstigator) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.4_data) Q5.5: According to the law, which candidate you vote for is supposed to be kept secret unless you tell someone. Even so, how easy or hard do you think it would be for politicians, union officials, or the people you work for to find out who you voted for, even if you told no one? Q5.5_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.5_ballotSecrecy) %>% group_by(Q5.5_ballotSecrecy) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.5_ballotSecrecy) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Impossible, my vote is secret", "It would be very hard, but not impossible", "It would be somewhat hard", "It would be somewhat easy", "It would be very easy")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.5_data) Q5.6: Do you think elected officials can access voting records and figure out who a voter has voted for? Q5.6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.6_officialsAccess) %>% group_by(Q5.6_officialsAccess) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.6_officialsAccess) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.6_data) Q5.7: Have you personally witnessed what you believe to be election or voter fraud in the 2020 Presidential Election? Q5.7_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.7_witnessFraud) %>% group_by(Q5.7_witnessFraud) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.7_witnessFraud) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.7_data) Q5.8: Which of the following situations did you personally observe in the 2020 Presidential Election? Please select all that apply. subs <- c("Q5.8_witnessFraud_bribery" = "Bribery or paying for votes", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_denial" = "Someone being improperly denied the chance to vote", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_fillingOutVBM" = "Someone filling out an absentee ballot for someone else", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_machineFailure" = "Voting machines failing to record votes correctly", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_falseID" = "Someone using a false identity to vote illegally", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_intimidation" = "Voter intimidation at the polling place", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_wrongMailArrived" = "A ballot came to your house that did not belong to anyone in your household", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_mailNeverArrived" = "A ballot you or someone in your household requested that did not arrive", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_dropboxStuffing" = "Someone stuffing a lot of ballots into an official ballot drop box", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_other" = "Other", "Q5.8_witnessFraud_none" = "None of these") Q5.8_data <- df %>% filter(if_any(Q5.8_witnessFraud_bribery:Q5.8_witnessFraud_none, ~ !is.na(.x))) %>% pivot_longer(Q5.8_witnessFraud_bribery:Q5.8_witnessFraud_none, names_to = "response") %>% drop_na(value) %>% group_by(response) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% mutate(response = recode(response, !!!subs)) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.8_data) Q5.9: Below is a list of possible illegal election activities that may or may not take place in your state. How often you think each event occurs? Voted absentee ballots are stolen and thrown away after being submitted Q5.9_1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_vbmStolenAfterSubmission_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_vbmStolenAfterSubmission_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_vbmStolenAfterSubmission_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_1_data) Someone intimidates a voter into voting for someone they didn’t want to Q5.9_2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_intimidationCastBallot_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_intimidationCastBallot_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_intimidationCastBallot_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_2_data) Someone steals an absentee ballot, changes the ballot, and casts it. Q5.9_3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_vbmStolenBefore_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_vbmStolenBefore_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_vbmStolenBefore_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_3_data) Someone bribes someone or pays them money for their vote Q5.9_4_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_bribery_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_bribery_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_bribery_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_4_data) Someone intimidates a voter into not voting Q5.9_5_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_intimidationNotVoting_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_intimidationNotVoting_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_intimidationNotVoting_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_5_data) Someone being denied the opportunity to vote who is an eligible voter by a poll worker or other election official Q5.9_6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_denial_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_denial_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_denial_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_6_data) Voting machines fail to record votes correctly Q5.9_7_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.9_machineFailure_frequency) %>% group_by(Q5.9_machineFailure_frequency) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.9_machineFailure_frequency) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "All or most of the time", "Some of the time", "Not much", "Hardly ever", "Never")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q5.9_7_data) Q5.10: Do you support or oppose requiring all people to show government issues photo ID when they vote? Q5.10_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.10_supportID) %>% group_by(Q5.10_supportID) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.10_supportID) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.10_data) Q5.11: Do you think fraud changed the outcome of the Presidential election in your state? Q5.11_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q5.11_fraudImpact) %>% group_by(Q5.11_fraudImpact) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q5.11_fraudImpact) freq_table_unsorted(Q5.11_data)
section-6-thinking-about-politics.html

Section 6: Thinking about Politics Q6.1: Party Q6.4: Compared to a year ago how are each of the following doing economically? Q6.5: For whom did you vote for in the race for U.S. President? Q6.6: Thinking about elections and election reform, which is more important? Q6.7: How do you think we should elect the President: the candidate who gets the most votes in all 50 states, or the current Electoral College system? Q6.8: Thinking about issues in politics today that matter to you, how often would you say your side has been winning or losing?

Section 6: Thinking about Politics Q6.1: Party df %>% drop_na(party) %>% group_by(party) %>% tally() %>% mutate(party = as_factor(party)) %>% ggplot(aes(x = party, y=n, fill = party)) + geom_col() + theme( panel.grid = element_blank(), legend.position = 'none', panel.background = element_blank(), axis.line = element_line(color = "black") ) + labs(y = "Total", x = "More Republican <-----> More Democratic") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#C93135", "#AF3C4B", "#964860", "#7C5376", "#625E8C", "#496AA1", "#2F75B7")) Q6.4: Compared to a year ago how are each of the following doing economically? You and your family Q6.4_1_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.4_familyEcon) %>% group_by(Q6.4_familyEcon) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.4_familyEcon) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Much better", "Somewhat better", "Same", "Somewhat worse", "Much worse")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q6.4_1_data) National economy Q6.4_2_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.4_nationalEcon) %>% group_by(Q6.4_nationalEcon) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.4_nationalEcon) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Much better", "Somewhat better", "Same", "Somewhat worse", "Much worse")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q6.4_2_data) State economy Q6.4_3_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.4_stateEcon) %>% group_by(Q6.4_stateEcon) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.4_stateEcon) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Much better", "Somewhat better", "Same", "Somewhat worse", "Much worse")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q6.4_3_data) Q6.5: For whom did you vote for in the race for U.S. President? Q6.5_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% group_by(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.5_presCandidate) freq_table_unsorted(Q6.5_data) Q6.6: Thinking about elections and election reform, which is more important? Q6.6_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.6_electionSystemPriority) %>% group_by(Q6.6_electionSystemPriority) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.6_electionSystemPriority) freq_table_unsorted(Q6.6_data) Q6.7: How do you think we should elect the President: the candidate who gets the most votes in all 50 states, or the current Electoral College system? Q6.7_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.7_electoralCollege) %>% group_by(Q6.7_electoralCollege) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.7_electoralCollege) freq_table_unsorted(Q6.7_data) Q6.8: Thinking about issues in politics today that matter to you, how often would you say your side has been winning or losing? Q6.8_data <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.8_yourSideWinning) %>% group_by(Q6.8_yourSideWinning) %>% tally() %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q6.8_yourSideWinning) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Winning a great deal more often than losing", "Winning somewhat more often than losing", "Winning and losing about equally", "Losing somewhat more often than winning", "Losing a great deal more often than winning")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(Q6.8_data)
weighted-frequencies.html

Weighted Frequencies National By State Q4.2: How confident are you that YOUR vote in the General Election was counted as you intended? Q4.3 Thinking about your county, state, and the nation, how confident are you that all of the ballots were counted as the voters intended?

Weighted Frequencies National Mode of Voting Frequencies national_totals <- df %>% drop_na(weights) %>% group_by(votingMethod) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) reactable(national_totals, columns = list( votingMethod = colDef(name = "Mode of Voting", footer = "Total"), n = colDef(footer = function(values) sum(values)) ), defaultColDef = colDef(footerStyle = list(fontWeight = "bold"))) Presidential Candidate Frequencies national_presCandidate_totals <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.5_presCandidate, weights) %>% group_by(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) reactable(national_presCandidate_totals, columns = list( Q6.5_presCandidate = colDef(name = "Presidential Candidate", footer = "Total"), n = colDef(footer = function(values) sum(values)) ), defaultColDef = colDef(footerStyle = list(fontWeight = "bold"))) By State Mode of Voting Frequencies state_totals <- df %>% drop_na(weights) %>% group_by(state) %>% tally() reactable( state_totals, details = function(index) { totals <- filter(df, state == state_totals$state[index]) %>% group_by(votingMethod) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) %>% rename("Mode of Voting" = votingMethod) tbl <- reactable(totals, outlined = TRUE, highlight = TRUE, fullWidth = TRUE) }, columns = list( state = colDef(name = "State") ), onClick = "expand", rowStyle = list(cursor = "pointer"), pagination = F ) Presidential Candidate Frequencies state_presCandidate_totals <- df %>% drop_na(Q6.5_presCandidate, weights) %>% group_by(state) %>% tally() reactable( state_presCandidate_totals, details = function(index) { totals <- filter(df, state == state_presCandidate_totals$state[index]) %>% drop_na(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% group_by(Q6.5_presCandidate) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(Percentage = round(100*n/sum(n), 2)) %>% rename("Presidential Candidate" = Q6.5_presCandidate) tbl <- reactable(totals, outlined = TRUE, highlight = TRUE, fullWidth = TRUE) }, columns = list( state = colDef(name = "State") ), onClick = "expand", rowStyle = list(cursor = "pointer"), pagination = F ) Q4.2: How confident are you that YOUR vote in the General Election was counted as you intended? tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.2_confidence, weights) %>% group_by(Q4.2_confidence) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.2_confidence) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Q4.3 Thinking about your county, state, and the nation, how confident are you that all of the ballots were counted as the voters intended? Your county tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_county, weights) %>% group_by(Q4.3_county) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_county) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Your state tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_state, weights) %>% group_by(Q4.3_state) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_state) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies) Nationwide tallies <- df %>% drop_na(Q4.3_nation, weights) %>% group_by(Q4.3_nation) %>% tally(wt = weights) %>% mutate(n = round(n)) %>% mutate(percent = n/sum(n)) %>% rename(response = Q4.3_nation) %>% mutate(response = as_factor(response)) %>% mutate(response = fct_relevel(response, "Very Confident", "Somewhat confident", "Not too confident", "Not at all confident")) %>% mutate(id = as.numeric(response)) %>% select(id, everything()) freq_table(tallies)

Introduction
Introduction Welcome to the survey results from the 2020 National Voter Satisfaction Survey you completed recently.
